integrated_verdict.confidence_statement: The Voynich Manuscript's Currier B control architecture is structurally compatible with — and discriminates uniquely toward — circulatory reflux distillation (pelican). Thread A: 25 sensory phenomena of pelican operation map bidirectionally to architectural features (98.3% coverage), hazard distribution matches pelican failure modes (rho=0.900), and the 6-state automaton maps to physically necessary operational modes (score=0.964). Thread B: All 7 alternative domains score below 37.5% compatibility, with 18/20 features being 'killer' discriminators that exclude all alternatives. This does NOT prove the manuscript is a distillation manual, but it establishes that no other 15th-century process domain produces a compatible structural fingerprint.

evidence_chain: T1: Joint fingerprint compiled from 18 source files, 20 binary features extracted
T2: Sensorimotor ontology covers 96.5% architecture->sensory, 100.0% sensory->architecture (VIABLE)
T3: Hazard phenomenology: pelican rank rho=0.900, 5/5 classes coherent, CONTAINMENT at 24% (COHERENT)
T4: Domain exclusion: gap=62.5%, best alternative=METALLURGY at 37.5%, 18 killer features (EXCLUDED)
T5: 6-state count DERIVED: 6/6 necessary, derivation score 0.964
